result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Debra A Nodland was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Debra A Nodland was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $3,600.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees. **NOTE: $5,000.00 has been applied toward the fines/costs.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol.
-----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------

supervisions.notes: Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan
No penalites ordered on this count.
